meanings.definition: To add or attach as an extra or subordinate part
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to annex a bonus question to the end of the test.
meanings.sent2: The students were excited when the teacher announced she would annex a fun activity to the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to annex some extra spices to the dish, but it turned out too spicy!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to annex more time to her day to get everything done.
meanings.sent5: The little girl wanted to annex a new toy to her collection.

meanings.definition: A building joined to or associated with a main building
meanings.sent1: The garage was built as an annex to the main house.
meanings.sent2: The school added an annex to accommodate the growing number of students.
meanings.sent3: The tiny annex in the backyard was used as a cozy reading nook.
meanings.sent4: The new office building was connected to the main one by an annex.
meanings.sent5: The hotel's annex provided additional rooms for guests.
